name: unremovable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be removed: The offender wears an unremovable ankle monitor. After being dismantled, it will leave behind in the ground an unremovable mass of concrete. Opposite
removable
More examplesFewer examplesOnly three out of five patients with large, unremovable tumours survive more than five years.They find themselves in a situation where incompetent directors are effectively unremovable.Security researchers are warning of malware that is proving to be unremovable even after a factory reset.There may be the option of installing unremovable devices that limit a vehicle's speed.
